Name: Valerie Hill
Description:
Valerie was a well-known drag queen and AIDS activist, and the winner of Miss Gay Akron 1978. She died after being shot in the abdomen by Edward Blazeff - who then turned the gun on himself.

> For days, fans have been leaving flowers and notes at the door, mourning the loss of Akron's best-known drag queen and AIDS activist. Slowly, as friends prepare for the funeral tomorrow, the realization sinks in: Valerie Hill, the soul of the gay community, is dead, apparently shot to death by a lover of 18 years, Edward Blazeff.
>
> The bodies of Blazeff, 34, and Hill, 48, were found in the bedroom of their North Akron home Wednesday. Although a final ruling has not been made by the coroner, evidence indicates that Blazeff shot Hill in the abdomen with a shotgun, then turned the gun on himself.
>
> There were no notes, no witnesses. Friends say the beginning of the end may have been an attic fire in June that destroyed Hill's wardrobe. Blazeff, an ex convict, was afraid he would be the chief suspect in the fire and had vowed that he would never go to prison
again.
>
> On the death certificate, Hill will be identified as a man named [deadname]. But unlike many female impersonators who dress only for the stage, Hill lived full time as a woman for decades. Even neighbors refer to Hill as "she" without any hint of irony.

https://ourcommunityroots.com/?p=83854

https://abj.newspapers.com/article/the-akron-beacon-journal-murder-of-trans/124564841/

Name: Linda Giron
Description:
Linda was found dead on the street in front of the civic center by the police after being stabbed several times in the chest by David Farias.

> A 32-year-old man arrested Saturday faces murder charges in connection with the Downtown slaying of a suspected [trans sex worker] July 22. David Farias, of 10393 Blythe, was picked up while house-sitting at an undisclosed location. He is accused of fatally stabbing [deadname] "Linda" Giron on the 200 block of West Franklin.
>
> Farias was picked up after police received a tip that he was involved in the crime. Farias was an acquaintance of Giron and was "the transient type," police spokesman Sgt. Bill Pfeil said. He was taken to the El Paso County Jail Saturday, where his bail was set at $75,000. Farias is charged with murdering 34-year-old Giron, of the 1500 block of East Missouri, who police say was a [sex worker] frequenting the Downtown area.
>
> Witnesses said Giron ran screaming from an alley at about 2:30 a.m. July 22 and collapsed, dying in front of the El Paso civic center. [She] was found by police with several knife wounds to his chest. [She] died of multiple wounds to the chest and abdomen, police said.
